definition: see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
machine/engine/opportunity/intention/aircraft/pivot/crucial point/flexible (quick-witted)/organic/CL:臺|台[tai2]
surname Ji
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]

sentences.english: I have no idea what they are going to say, so I'll have to play it by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我一點不知道他們將會說什麼，所以我只好見機行事。

sentences.english: Opportunity must be seized and acted upon in order to have value.
sentences.chinese: 必須抓住機會，見機行事才能創造佳績。

sentences.english: I’ve had no time to prepare for this meeting,so I’ll have to play it by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有時間來準備這次會議，所以我只好見機行事。

sentences.english: He is a man who knows the time of day.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個能見機行事的人。

sentences.english: Since you don't know the language, I can only suggest that you follow your nose.
sentences.chinese: 你既然不會這門語言，我只能建議你見機行事。

sentences.english: I am not prepared the speech, so I have to play it by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我沒準備演講稿，到時只好見機行事。

sentences.english: We have no set plans, We're just going to do AS we see fit.
sentences.chinese: 我們沒有即定的計劃，我們將見機行事。

sentences.english: I don't know what they'll want when they arrive─we'll have to play it by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道他們到達時需要什麼我們只有見機行事了。

sentences.english: He learned to pick up on his superior's moods and act accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 他學會了注意上級的情緒並見機行事。

sentences.english: John decided to play it by ear when he went for his interview.
sentences.chinese: 約翰決定面試的時候見機行事。

sentences.english: When using loudspeakers , be sure to use your discretion. You can't teach others with a cudgel.
sentences.chinese: 使用高音喇叭，千萬要見機行事，不能授人以柄。

sentences.english: We don't know what to do now, so we must play by ear.
sentences.chinese: 我們不知怎麼做，所以必須見機行事。

definition: to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
having nothing better to do
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
foolish talk/nonsense
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
A rabbit doesn't eat the grass by its own burrow (idiom); One shouldn't do anything to harm one's neighbors.
pinyin: tu4 zi5 bu4 chi1 wo1 bian1 cao3

definition: (not) a single person/(no) one
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
sugar-coated bullets, term used by Mao (originally in 1949) to refer to corrupting bourgeois influences
to drown sb in a wicker basket, a form of 沉潭[chen2 tan2]
lit. to give medicine to a dead horse (idiom)/fig. to keep trying everything in a desperate situation
pinyin: si3 ma3 dang4 huo2 ma3 yi1
